availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Commodore P. Snell (Warren County, Kentucky, constable and Private (C.S.A.))

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, constable and Private (C.S.A.). Pennsylvania native. Father of Melvin Snell, William Snell, Nancy A. Snell. Married to Elender Snell c1850. Laborer in Warren County, Kentucky in 1850. Nominated as constable for Warren County, Kentucky in December 1861 at Provisional Government of the State of Kentucky session. Served in 2nd Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as private from August 14, 1862 to 1865. Constable in Warren County, Kentucky in 1870.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 60.Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 90.Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 592.Find A Grave, "Commodore Perry Snell (July 13, 1821-May 3, 1881)," Memorial #55357289, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55357289 (accessed January 25, 2020).
